organization_name: City and County of San Francisco
notes: Collected manually by operators. Weekday two vehicles operate 12pm-6pm. Weekends/Holidays three vehicles operate 9am-6pm.
APCs are not NTD-certified and has error rate above 5% threshold required by NTD. This is the only source for stop-level data at this time.

Several buses without APC hardware (5 in March and 8 in April 2025) didn't collect data. Clever Insights failed to collect APC data on all routes from 2025-06-16 to 2025-06-30. Each stop id has two rows (stop_name, stop_name [stop_id])

Dataset include most specific fixed route data. Data collected by Dilax APCs goes through trip matching process and projection process. Data provided is final projected boardings/alightings used for official reporting. 1.1% of trips locked by Dilax and unusable. No service on Thanksgiving and Christmas day.
Data collected from APCs. Stop IDs consistent with GTFS Stop IDs over the same time.

organization_name: Golden Gate Bridge, Highway and Transportation District
notes: The dataset includes stop-level ridership and virtual time point data. When POINT_ROLE = 'T', the entries do not contain boarding or alighting information.

organization_name: San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit District

notes: Big Blue Bus implement three service that changes annually, referenced as SERVICE_PERIOD and named after the month they take effect in raw data. Each service lasts for approximately 4 months.
Compiled through survey efforts, supplemented with APC data.
Data collected using APC and sourced through Hopthru, which the agency received NTD certification for. In rare event that the APCs do not recognize a data point and discard it.
We received raw data for May and October, from 2018 to 2025. In first release we only import May 2025 data, which contains most clear and comprehensive columns/info.

Data collected with Hella APCs and processed by UTA Transit. Data is undercount. Trips that were rejected by APC processing software are dropped. Data reported to NTD is factored to replace the rejected trips and is higher.
2025/2/4 has highest boarding in Q1 2025. Stop id extracted from raw stop name.
Ridership numbers are estimated based on sales data from the various methods passengers pay for Caltrain fares.
